title: X Factor Celebrity adds The Chase Jenny Ryan to live shows
text:
Caption: Jenny Ryan AKA The Vixen appearing on Good Morning Britain (Picture: Syco/Rex; ITV)

The Chase star Jenny Ryan will join the other finalists when the live shows kick off on Saturday.

Fans were massively disappointed the quiz show star didn’t make it through to the live shows despite her impressive performance of Queen’s Somebody To Love.

Last week viewers saw her find out that at the moment she would not be getting a yes from the judges.

But Simon Cowell, Nicole Scherzinger and Louis Walsh have since had a change of heart and will give her a shot at the X Factor crown.

The 37-year-old will join Team Scherzy and the Overs.

Nicole said: ‘Jenny was just brilliant at her audition in LA. That voice of hers is one of a kind, and she’s an amazing person to get to know. So it was such a tough decision to make.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘After a lot of discussion we all agreed we had to put her through. The Overs are gonna smash it this year!’

This is the best news! (Picture: ITV)

And Jenny herself is super excited to be able to continue her singing journey.

‘I’ve loved every moment of The X Factor and I’m delighted to be able to get the opportunity to perform live. The response from the public has been amazing – what an incredible experience. I’m so pleased it’s continuing!’ she said.

Simon, Nicole and Louis confirmed the line- up for the live shows after the auditions – which did away with boot camp and the Six Chair Challenge.

For the finals, Simon has groups Max and Harvey, V5, Try Star, Love Islanders; Louis will coach the Unders Jonny Labey, Kevin McHale, Olivia Olson and Megan McKenna and Nicole will handle the Overs Victoria Ekanoye, Ricki Lake, Martin Bashir, and Vinnie Jones.

The X Factor Celebrity continues Saturday at 8.20pm on ITV.

description: X Factor Celebrity adds The Chase Jenny Ryan to live shows in wake of viewer backlash
